questions.question: 1. Leah adds a cup of uncooked rice to a cup of dried peas in a bowl. Which of the following will not happen?

choices.answer: They form a new chemical substance
They rest together in the bowl

questions.question: 3. Callie added a cup of water to a quarter cup of salt and stirred the mixture for several minutes. What happened?

choices.answer: A The salt dissolved in the water, and the water stayed cloudy.
B The salt floated on top of the water and did not dissolve.
C The salt crystals sank to the bottom of the water and remained whole.
D The salt dissolved in the water, and the water became clear.

questions.question: 4. A student makes a solution by mixing a flavored, powdered drink mix into water. What part of water stays the SAME?
5. Xavier added a cup of sugar to a cup of lemon juice and stirred for one minute. What happened?

choices.answer: A The sugar sank to the bottom and remained separate from the lemon juice.
B The sugar dissolved, and the lemon juice became sweeter.
C The lemon juice evaporated, and the sugar remained.
D The sugar floated on top of the lemon juice and remained separate.

questions.question: Which is the best insulator?  Plastic Cup-40 degrees    Glass Cup-32 degrees  Foam cup-50 degrees Metal Cup-24 degrees
7. Which of these materials has the greatest density?
8.  Which material does NOT dissolve in water?
9. Isabel mixes together water, salt, rocks, and sugar. How many of these substances can be seen after she mixes them?
10. Students add sugar and flavored drink mix to a pitcher of water and stir the mixture twenty times. What happens?

choices.answer: A The sugar and drink mix combine to form a solid at the bottom
B The sugar maintains all of its properties, but the drink mix does not.
C The sugar and the drink mix change their physical state completely.
D The size of the sugar and drink mix particles becomes smaller
